U: S. President Donald Trump's financial stake in companies producing hydroxychloroquine is virtually negligible, as it is contained indirectly via mutual funds and administered through family trusts he does not control.
Hydroxychloroquine is a generic drug: making it unlikely to provide significant profits to any one company compared to other proprietary drugs.
The New York Times reported that Trump h: a French company that produces the brand-name version of hydroxychloroquine.
Trump: s financial disclosure report shows that he earns income from three family trusts, which are partially invested in mutual funds that include minor holdings in pharmaceutical companies, including Sanofi. These trusts are administered independently by J.P. Morgan.
